results.adx_keywords: Discrimination;Health Insurance and Managed Care;United States Politics and Government;Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010);Transgender and Transsexuals;Trump, Donald J;Human Rights Campaign;Health and Human Services Department
results.byline: By Margot Sanger-Katz and Noah Weiland
results.title: Trump Administration Erases Transgender Civil Rights Protections in Health Care
results.abstract: A rule finalized on Friday by the Department of Health and Human Services means that the federal government no longer recognizes gender identity as an avenue for sex discrimination in health care.
des_facet: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

media.caption: An empty hallway filled with gurneys at a hospital in Queens. The new rule will erase protections for transgender patients against discrimination in the health care sector.

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Television
results.title: The Protests Come for ‘Paw Patrol’
results.abstract: A backlash is mounting against depictions of “good cops,” on television and in the street.

media.caption: Chase is on the case in “Paw Patrol,” but as protests against racist police violence reach their third week, criticism of fictional cops is growing, too.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV)
results.title: Surging Coronavirus Cases Push Latin America ‘to the Limit’
results.abstract: The U.S. caseload, already the world’s highest, is approaching two million. A book about the fall of France in 1940 has become a hit during the pandemic.

media.caption: A Covid-19 field hospital on the outskirts of Sao Paulo, Brazil, on Tuesday.

results.adx_keywords: Presidential Election of 2020;Endorsements;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Bush, George W;Mattis, James N;McCain, Cindy;Powell, Colin L;Romney, Mitt;Rooney, Francis (1953- );Republican Party
results.title: Vote for Trump? These Republican Leaders Aren’t on the Bandwagon
results.abstract: Former President George W. Bush and Senator Mitt Romney won’t support Mr. Trump’s re-election. Colin Powell will vote for Joe Biden, and other G.O.P. officials may do the same.

media.caption: Former Secretary of State Colin Powell said he would vote for Joe Biden, telling CNN that President Trump “lies about things.”

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Quarantines;Coronavirus Reopenings;Doctors;Medicine and Health;Epidemics;Henry, Bonnie (Doctor);British Columbia (Canada)
results.title: The Top Doctor Who Aced the Coronavirus Test
results.abstract: Dr. Bonnie Henry kept the disease in check in British Columbia without harsh enforcement methods. Now, she is leading the way out of lockdown.

media.caption: British Columbia’s provincial health officer, Dr. Bonnie Henry, has won praise for minimizing the impact of Covid-19 on the province.
media.copyright: Jackie Dives for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Durkan, Jenny A;Inslee, Jay;Trump, Donald J;Seattle (Wash)
results.title: Free Food, Free Speech and Free of Police: Inside Seattle’s ‘Autonomous Zone’
results.abstract: President Trump challenged Seattle’s mayor to “take back your city” after the police vacated a station house and protesters laid claim to the neighborhood around it.

media.caption: A gathering on Wednesday in the Seattle neighborhood of Capitol Hill, where protesters have established an “autonomous zone.”

results.adx_keywords: Food;Race and Ethnicity;Social Media;Appointments and Executive Changes;Magazines;Discrimination;Puerto Ricans;Black Lives Matter Movement;Rapoport, Adam;Bon Appetit (Magazine);Conde Nast Publications Inc
results.title: Bon Appétit Editor Adam Rapoport Resigns
results.abstract: The move comes hours after a photo of him resurfaced on social media, drawing condemnations from the staff for a stereotypical depiction of Puerto Ricans.

media.caption: Adam Rapoport took over as editor in chief of Bon Appétit in 2010, after years as the style editor at GQ.
media.copyright: Ike Edeani for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020)
results.title: Seattle Mayor Defies Trump
results.abstract: The mayor defended Seattle’s decision to cede an “autonomous zone” to protesters. A Chicago congressman says security video shows police officers relaxing in his offices while nearby stores were vandalized.

media.caption: The Seattle Police Department’s East Precinct building, which has been boarded up and abandoned, on Thursday.

results.adx_keywords: Transplants;Lungs;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Surgery and Surgeons;Tissue (Human);your-feed-healthcare;Northwestern Memorial Hospital (Chicago, Ill)
results.title: Covid-19 Patient Gets Double Lung Transplant, Offering Hope for Others
results.abstract: The operation is believed to be the first of its kind in the U.S. The patient, a woman in her 20s, had been healthy, but the coronavirus devastated her lungs.

media.caption: An extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, or ECMO, room, where coronavirus patients struggling to breathe are treated, at a Northwestern Medicine facility in Chicago.

results.adx_keywords: Advertising and Marketing;News and News Media;Television;George Floyd Protests (2020);Black Lives Matter Movement;Carlson, Tucker;Fox News Channel;Papa Johns International Inc;T-Mobile US Inc;Walt Disney Company
results.title: Fox News Host Tucker Carlson Loses More Advertisers
results.abstract: Disney, Papa John’s, Poshmark and T-Mobile backed away from “Tucker Carlson Tonight” after the host’s comments about Black Lives Matter protests.

media.caption: Advertiser disavowals of Tucker Carlson’s show, “Tucker Carlson Tonight,” have gained momentum.

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020)
results.title: Majority of Minneapolis City Council Pledges to Dismantle Police Department
results.abstract: Some cities are starting to to heed calls to “defund the police,” as lawmakers push proposals for greater police accountability. National Guard troops are being sent home from Washington, D.C.

results.adx_keywords: George Floyd Protests (2020);Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;Prison Guards and Corrections Officers;Whites;Discrimination;Floyd, George (d 2020);Franklin Township (Gloucester County, NJ)
results.byline: By Ed Shanahan and Tracey Tully
results.title: Man Who Mocked George Floyd’s Killing Is Fired by FedEx
results.abstract: One white counterprotester yelled while kneeling on the neck of another who was facedown on the ground. The display drew fierce condemnation.

media.caption: People gathered for a Black Lives Matter protest in Franklin Township, N.J., on Monday.

results.adx_keywords: Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Hydroxychloroquine (Drug);Chloroquine (Drug);Hospitals;Academic and Scientific Journals;Electronic Health Records;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Rumors and Misinformation;Data-Mining and Database Marketing;Research;your-feed-science;Mehra, Mandeep;Desai, Sapan;Lancet, The (Journal);New England Journal of Medicine
results.byline: By Roni Caryn Rabin and Ellen Gabler
results.title: Two Huge Covid-19 Studies Are Retracted After Scientists Sound Alarms
results.abstract: The reports, published in two leading journals, were retracted after authors could not verify an enormous database of medical records.

media.caption: Two prominent studies on the drugs chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine that used the same dataset from a company called Surgisphere were retracted on Thursday.

results.byline: By Jessica Silver-Greenberg, Jesse Drucker and David Enrich
results.title: Hospitals Got Bailouts and Furloughed Thousands While Paying C.E.O.s Millions
results.abstract: Dozens of top recipients of government aid have laid off, furloughed or cut the pay of tens of thousands of employees.
des_facet: Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security Act (2020)

media.caption: HCA Healthcare, based in Nashville, received about $1 billion in federal bailout funds, part of an effort to stabilize hospitals during the pandemic.

results.adx_keywords: Pop and Rock Music;Dylan, Bob
results.title: Bob Dylan Has a Lot on His Mind
results.abstract: In a rare interview, the Nobel Prize winner discusses mortality, drawing inspiration from the past, and his new album, “Rough and Rowdy Ways.”

media.caption: Bob Dylan’s “Rough and Rowdy Ways” is his first album of original songs since 2012.

results.title: From 2018: Senate Unanimously Passes Bill Making Lynching a Federal Crime
results.abstract: Nearly 200 similar bills have been introduced in Congress from 1882 to 1996, but none have successfully passed both chambers.

results.title: For Mayor Jacob Frey of Minneapolis, a Stinging Rebuke
results.abstract: A sea of protesters yelled, “Go home, Jacob, go home!” and “Shame! Shame!” when he would not, on the spot, commit to abolishing the Police Department.

results.title: 5 Rules to Live By During a Pandemic
results.abstract: There’s no playbook for living through a pandemic, so we decided to create one. With some basic rules to guide you, everyone can lower risk and live a full life while we wait for the virus to get under control.

media.caption: Abby Fisher, a hostess, prepares a table at Lindey’s restaurant in Columbus, Ohio on June 5.

results.title: Yes, We Mean Literally Abolish the Police
results.abstract: Because reform won’t happen.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Black People;Black Lives Matter Movement;George Floyd Protests (2020);Chauvin, Derek (1976- );Floyd, George (d 2020);Police Department (Minneapolis, Minn);Minneapolis (Minn)
results.byline: By Evan Hill, Ainara Tiefenthäler, Christiaan Triebert, Drew Jordan, Haley Willis and Robin Stein
results.title: 8 Minutes and 46 Seconds: How George Floyd Was Killed in Police Custody
results.abstract: The Times has reconstructed the death of George Floyd on May 25. Security footage, witness videos and official documents show how a series of actions by officers turned fatal.
